Package com.waddle_ware.heslington_hustle.core

Class Time

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.waddle_ware.heslington_hustle.core.Time
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    ResourceBase
    public class Time
extends java.lang.Object
implements ResourceBase
    The Time class manages time in the game, representing a day with a specific duration (16 hours). It implements the ResourceBase interface for resource management.

    • Constructor Detail

      • Time

        public Time​(int mins_per_dec,
            int secs_to_dec)
        Constructs a Time instance with specified parameters.
        Parameters:
        mins_per_dec - The number of game minutes to decrement in each update cycle.
        secs_to_dec - The number of real-time seconds to decrement for each game time decrement.

    • Method Detail

      • update

        public void update()
        Updates the time, decrementing game time if necessary. This method is called to passively drain time.

      • reset

        public void reset()
        Description copied from interface: ResourceBase
        Resets the resource to its initial state. Intended to be used when the day resets.
        Specified by:
        reset in interface ResourceBase

      • getIntervalsRemaining

        public int getIntervalsRemaining()
        Gets the number of bars to display in the progress bar on the HUD.
        Returns:
        The number of minutes remaining divided by MINS_IN_INTERVAL.

      • getMinutesRemaining

        public int getMinutesRemaining()
        Gets the number of game minutes remaining. Used by internal core function to check whether the game has ended
        Returns:
        The number of game minutes remaining.

      • isOk

        public ExitConditions isOk​(int amount)
        Description copied from interface: ResourceBase
        Checks whether the specified amount of a resource is sufficient.
        Specified by:
        isOk in interface ResourceBase
        Parameters:
        amount - The amount of the resource to check.
        Returns:
        An ExitCondition(TooLow, TooHigh, IsOK) indicating if there are any issues with the amount of the resource.

      • tryActivityType

        public ResourceExitConditions tryActivityType​(ActivityType type)
        Description copied from interface: ResourceBase
        Attempts to perform the specified type of activity with the resource. Does NOT change the internal state if a request succeeds
        Specified by:
        tryActivityType in interface ResourceBase
        Parameters:
        type - The type of activity to attempt.
        Returns:
        A ResourceExitConditions object indicating whether it is possible to perform the activity.
